doc.after: On March 10, 2013 the WSJ reported that Honeywell was one of sixty companies that shielded annual profits from U.S. taxes. [95] In December 2011, the non-partisan liberal organization Public Campaign criticized Honeywell International for spending $18.3 million on lobbying and not paying any taxes during 2008â2010, instead getting $34 million in tax rebates, despite making a profit of $4.9 billion, laying off 968 workers since 2008, and increasing executive pay by 15% to $54.2 million in 2010 for its top 5 executives.[96] Honeywell has been criticized in the past for its manufacture of deadly and maiming weapons, such as cluster bombs.[citation needed]
